item.title: Expressing support for the goals of November National Lung Cancer Awareness Month and for the early detection and treatment of lung cancer.

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Health.

item.title: A resolution designating November 2024 as "National Lung Cancer Awareness Month" and expressing support for early detection and treatment of lung cancer.

latestAction.text: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent. (consideration: CR S6734; text: CR S6729-6730)

item.title: Expressing support for the designation of November 2024 as "National Lung Cancer Awareness Month" and expressing support for early detection and treatment of lung cancer.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Energy and Commerce.

item.text: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent. (consideration: CR S6029; text: CR S6023-6024)
Passed/agreed to in Senate: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent. (consideration: CR S6029; text: CR S6023-6024)

cdata.text: This resolution designates November 2023 as National Lung Cancer Awareness Month. The bill also designates the first week of November 2023 as National Women's Lung Cancer Awareness Week and the second Saturday of November 2023 as National Lung Cancer Screening Day. The resolution also promotes awareness of, education about, and research on lung cancer.

This resolution designates November 2023 as National Lung Cancer Awareness Month. The resolution also promotes awareness of, education about, and research on lung cancer.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
